statement.p: If the Diamond DA-20 climbs at the rate of \displaystyle\frac{{{450}\ \text{ feet}}}{{{1.0}\ \text{ minute}}} how long will it take it to climb \displaystyle{2},{500} ft?

solution.p: Because the climb rate is treated as a constant we setup the proportion

p.m: \displaystyle\frac{{{450}\ \text{ feet}}}{{{1.0}\ \text{ minute}}}\cdot{\left({t}\ \text{ minutes}\right)}=\frac{{{2},{500}\ \text{ feet}}}{{{t}\ \text{ minutes}}}\cdot{\left({t}\ \text{ minutes}\right)}
